tool.name: Phytab RAxML using Starting trees
tool.description: Phytab RAxML - optimize branch lengths on trees

param.name: startingPtreelist
param.label: Starting trees
param.help: (e.g., tree list output from PHYTAB RAxML Parsimony.)

param.name: evo
param.label: Model of evolution to apply to all data partitions (-m)

param.name: efile
param.label: Tab seperated file with partition name in first column, evolutionary model in the second column. Must be RAxML valid model names. (optional)

tool.help:
**What it does**
This tool estimates likelihood trees and branch lengths for a PHYTAB file using starting trees (e.g., parsimony trees) to accelerate tree estimation.
**Input requirements**
1. PHYTAB sequence file 2. Starting tree list: two tab-delimited columns with the partition(gene) name and its newick starting tree (generated by PHYTAB RAxML-Parsimony)::
geneA (((Species_a,Species_b),Species_c),Species_d); geneB ((Species_a,Species_b),(Species_c,Species_d));
